greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Luhn algorithm double-and-add sum of digits of n.
comment: Starting on the right, sum digits after doubling alternating digits beginning with the second. If doubled digit >9, reduce by 9 (sum of digits).
a(n) = A007953(A249873(n); A093019(n) = 10 - a(10*n) mod 10 if less than 10, otherwise 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 08 2014
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
John Kilgo, DotNetJohn.com, Using the Luhn Algorithm
Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of n
example: a(59) = (1+0) + 9 = 10 (1 and 0 are the digits in 10 = 2*5).
program: where (n', td) = divMod n 100; (t, d) = divMod td 10
results.author: _Ray Chandler_, Apr 03 2004
